title: Could not run conda env create -f DLC-GPU.yaml
body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** MacOS Big Sur 11.2.1, I just installed DLC so I believe it should be the latest version, with an Anaconda Env *****Note, I am trying to run DLC on a remote server from my school. Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using. Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut1.x or 2.x. Please complete the following information about your system: OS: Mac OS DeepLabCut Version: n/a Anaconda env used: conda 4.9.2 Tensorflow Version: 2.3.0 **Describe the problem** When I am trying to run conda env create -f DLC-GPU.yaml I was encountered with 'ResolvePackageNotFound: ' Please place code inside this: Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done Solving environment: failed ResolvePackageNotFound: - tensorflow-gpu==1.13.1 - cudnn=7
Code output

ResolvePackageNotFound: - tensorflow-gpu==1.13.1 - cudnn=7

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to '...' 2. Click on '....' 3. Scroll down to '....' 4. See error **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.
